sections.1_story: Imagine you invest money in a bank and your interest is added to your principal every year. Compound interest helps you grow your savings faster and is important for exams and real-life finance.
2_definitions: ğŸ’¡ Compound Interest (CI): Interest calculated on the initial principal and also on the accumulated interest from previous periods.
ğŸ’¡ Principal (P): The original sum of money lent or invested.
ğŸ’¡ Rate (R): The percentage of interest per year.
ğŸ’¡ Time (T): The period for which money is lent or invested, usually in years.
ğŸ’¡ Amount (A): The total money after adding compound interest to principal (A = P + CI).
ğŸ’¡ Compounding: The process of adding interest to principal at regular intervals.
ğŸ’¡ Yearly Compounding: Interest is added once a year.
ğŸ’¡ Half-yearly Compounding: Interest is added twice a year.
ğŸ’¡ Quarterly Compounding: Interest is added four times a year.
ğŸ’¡ Effective Rate: The actual rate earned due to compounding.
